member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog
member.summary: Used to create fogging effects such as clouds but with a density that is related to the height of the fog.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogDensity
member.summary: The fog density factor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogHeightFalloff
member.summary: The fog height density factor that controls how the density increases as height decreases. The smaller values produce more visible transition larger.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogInscatteringColor
member.summary: Color of the fog.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogMaxOpacity
member.summary: Maximum opacity of the fog. A value of 1 means the fog can become fully opaque at a distance and replace scene color completely. A value of 0 means the fog color will not be factored in at all.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.StartDistance
member.summary: Distance from the camera that the fog will start, in world units.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogCutoffDistance
member.summary: Scene elements past this distance will not have fog applied. This is useful for excluding skyboxes which already have fog baked in.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringLight
member.summary: Directional light used for Directional Inscattering.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringExponent
member.summary: Controls the size of the directional inscattering cone, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used. Range: 2-64.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringStartDistance
member.summary: Controls the start distance from the viewer of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEnable
member.summary: Whether to enable Volumetric fog. Graphics quality settings control the resolution of the fog simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogScatteringDistribution
member.summary: Controls the scattering phase function - how much incoming light scatters in various directions. A distribution value of 0 scatters equally in all directions, while 0.9 scatters predominantly in the light direction. In order to have visible volumetric fog light shafts from the side, the distribution will need to be closer to 0. Range: -0.9-0.9.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogAlbedo
member.summary: The height fog particle reflectiveness used by volumetric fog. Water particles in air have an albedo near white, while dust has slightly darker value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEmissive
member.summary: Light emitted by height fog. This is a density so more light is emitted the further you are looking through the fog. In most cases using a Skylight is a better choice, however, it may be useful in certain scenarios.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogExtinctionScale
member.summary: Scales the height fog particle extinction amount used by volumetric fog. Values larger than 1 cause fog particles everywhere absorb more light. Range: 0.1-10.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogDistance
member.summary: Distance over which volumetric fog should be computed. Larger values extend the effect into the distance but expose under-sampling artifacts in details.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Light
member.summary: Base class for all light types.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Light.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.Color
member.summary: Color of the light

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.Brightness
member.summary: Brightness of the light

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.ViewDistance
member.summary: Controls light visibility range. The distance at which the light be completely faded. Use value 0 to always draw light.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.IndirectLightingIntensity
member.summary: Controls how much this light will contribute indirect lighting. When set to 0, there is no GI from the light. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.VolumetricScatteringIntensity
member.summary: Controls how much this light will contribute to the Volumetric Fog. When set to 0, there is no contribution.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.CastVolumetricShadow
member.summary: Toggles whether or not to cast a volumetric shadow for lights contributing to Volumetric Fog. Also shadows casting by this light should be enabled in order to make it cast volumetric fog shadow.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow
member.summary: Base class for all light types that can cast dynamic or static shadow. Contains more shared properties for point/spot/directional lights.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.MinRoughness
member.summary: The minimum roughness value used to clamp material surface roughness during shading pixel.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsDistance
member.summary: The light shadows casting distance from view.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsFadeDistance
member.summary: The light shadows fade off distance

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsSharpness
member.summary: The light shadows edges sharpness

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsStrength
member.summary: Dynamic shadows blending strength. Default is 1 for fully opaque shadows, value 0 disables shadows.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsDepthBias
member.summary: The depth bias used for shadow map comparison.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsNormalOffsetScale
member.summary: A factor specifying the offset to add to the calculated shadow map depth with respect to the surface normal.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ContactShadowsLength
member.summary: The length of the rays for contact shadows computed via the screen-space tracing. Set this to values higher than 0 to enable screen-space shadows rendering for this light. This improves the shadowing details. Actual ray distance is based on the pixel distance from the camera.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsMode
member.summary: Shadows casting mode by this visual element

member.summary: Sets the material to the entry slot. Can be used to override the material of the meshes using this slot.

member.summary: Utility to crate a new virtual Material Instance asset, set its parent to the currently applied material, and assign it to the entry. Can be used to modify the material parameters from code.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ModelInstanceActor.IntersectsEntry(System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Ray@,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines if there is an intersection between the model actor mesh entry and a ray. If mesh data is available on the CPU performs exact intersection check with the geometry. Otherwise performs simple vs test. For more efficient collisions detection and ray casting use physics.
member.param: The material slot entry index to test.
When the method completes and returns true, contains the distance of the intersection (if any valid).
When the method completes, contains the intersection surface normal vector (if any valid).
member.returns: True if the actor is intersected by the ray, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ModelInstanceActor.IntersectsEntry(FlaxEngine.Ray@,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines if there is an intersection between the model actor mesh entry and a ray. If mesh data is available on the CPU performs exact intersection check with the geometry. Otherwise performs simple vs test. For more efficient collisions detection and ray casting use physics.
member.param: When the method completes and returns true, contains the distance of the intersection (if any valid).
When the method completes, contains the intersection surface normal vector (if any valid).
When the method completes, contains the intersection entry index (if any valid).
member.returns: True if the actor is intersected by the ray, otherwise false.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll
member.summary: Actor that synchronizes Animated Model skeleton pose with physical bones bodies simulated with physics. Child rigidbodies are used for per-bone simulation - rigidbodies names must match skeleton bone name and should be ordered based on importance in the skeleton tree (parents first).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.BonesWeight
member.summary: The default bones weight where 0 means fully animated bone and 1 means fully simulate bones. Can be used to control all bones simulation mode but is overriden by per-bone BonesWeights.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.BonesWeights
member.summary: The per-bone weights for ragdoll simulation. Key is bone name, value is the blend weight where 0 means fully animated bone and 1 means fully simulated bone. Can be used to control per-bone simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.PositionSolverIterations
member.summary: The minimum number of position iterations the physics solver should perform for bodies in this ragdoll. Higher values improve stability but affect performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.VelocitySolverIterations
member.summary: The minimum number of velocity iterations the physics solver should perform for bodies in this ragdoll. Higher values improve stability but affect performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: The maximum depenetration velocity when ragdoll's rigidbody moving out of penetrating state. Using this property can smooth objects moving out of colliding state and prevent unstable motion.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.TotalMass
member.summary: Calculates the total mass of all ragdoll bodies.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.SetLinearVelocity(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the linear velocity of all rigidbodies in the ragdoll.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.SetAngularVelocity(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the angular velocity of all rigidbodies in the ragdoll (in radians per second).

member.summary: Gets or sets the spline model quality scale. Higher values improve the spline representation (better tessellation) but reduce performance.

member.summary: Gets or sets the model bounds scale. It is useful when using Position Offset to animate the vertices of the object outside of its bounds.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SplineModel.LODBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the model Level Of Detail bias value. Allows to increase or decrease rendered model quality.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SplineModel.ForcedLOD
member.summary: Gets or sets the model forced Level Of Detail index. Allows to bind the given model LOD to show. Value -1 disables this feature.

member.returns: The root of the prefab object loaded from the prefab. Contains the default values. It's not added to gameplay but deserialized with postLoad and init event fired.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Prefab.GetDefaultInstance(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Requests the default prefab object instance. Deserializes the prefab objects from the asset. Skips if already done.
member.param: The ID of the object to get from prefab default object. It can be one of the child-actors or any script that exists in the prefab. Methods returns root if id is empty.
member.returns: The object of the prefab loaded from the prefab. Contains the default values. It's not added to gameplay but deserialized with postLoad and init event fired.

member.summary: The scene asset typename. Type of the serialized scene asset data. Hidden class for the scene assets. Actors deserialization rules are strictly controlled under the hood by the C++ core parts. Mostly because scene asset has the same ID as scene root actor so loading both managed objects for scene asset and scene will crash (due to object ids conflict).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Navigation
member.summary: The navigation service used for path finding and agents navigation system.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Navigation.IsBuildingNavMesh
member.summary: Returns true if navigation system is during navmesh building (any request is valid or async task active).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Navigation.NavMeshBuildingProgress
member.summary: Gets the navmesh building progress (normalized to range 0-1).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.FindDistanceToWall(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.NavMeshHit@,System.Single)
member.summary: Finds the distance from the specified start position to the nearest polygon wall.
member.param: The result hit information. Valid only when query succeed.
The maximum distance to search for wall (search radius).
member.returns: True if ray hits an matching object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.FindPath(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3[]@)
member.summary: Finds the path between the two positions presented as a list of waypoints stored in the corners array.
member.returns: True if found valid path between given two points (it may be partial), otherwise false if failed.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.TestPath(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Tests the path between the two positions (non-partial).
member.returns: True if found valid path between given two points, otherwise false if failed.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.ProjectPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Projects the point to nav mesh surface (finds the nearest polygon).
member.param: The result position on the navmesh (valid only if method returns true).
member.returns: True if found valid location on the navmesh, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.FindRandomPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Finds random location on nav mesh.
member.param: The result position on the navmesh (valid only if method returns true).
member.returns: True if found valid location on the navmesh, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.FindRandomPointAroundCircle(FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Finds random location on nav mesh within the reach of specified location.
member.param: The source point to find random location around it.
The search distance for a random point. Maximum distance for a result point from the center of the circle.
The result position on the navmesh (valid only if method returns true).
member.returns: True if found valid location on the navmesh, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.NavMeshHit@)
member.summary: Casts a 'walkability' ray along the surface of the navigation mesh from the start position toward the end position.
member.param: The result hit information. Valid only when query succeed.
member.returns: True if ray hits an matching object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.BuildNavMesh(FlaxEngine.Scene,System.Single)
member.summary: Builds the Nav Mesh for the given scene (discards all its tiles).
member.remarks: Requests are enqueued till the next game scripts update. Actual navmesh building in done via Thread Pool tasks in a background to prevent game thread stalls.
member.param: The timeout to wait before building Nav Mesh (in milliseconds).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.BuildNavMesh(FlaxEngine.Scene,FlaxEngine.BoundingBox,System.Single)
member.summary: Builds the Nav Mesh for the given scene (builds only the tiles overlapping the given bounding box).
member.remarks: Requests are enqueued till the next game scripts update. Actual navmesh building in done via Thread Pool tasks in a background to prevent game thread stalls.
member.param: The bounds in world-space to build overlapping tiles.
The timeout to wait before building Nav Mesh (in milliseconds).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties
member.summary: The navigation system agent properties container for navmesh building and querying.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the agent used for navigation. Agents can't pass through gaps of less than twice the radius.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.Height
member.summary: The height of the agent used for navigation. Agents can't enter areas with ceilings lower than this value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.StepHeight
member.summary: The step height used for navigation. Defines the maximum ledge height that is considered to still be traversable by the agent.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.MaxSlopeAngle
member.summary: The maximum slope (in degrees) that is considered walkable for navigation. Agents can't go up or down slopes higher than this value.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties
member.summary: The navigation mesh properties container for navmesh building.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Name
member.summary: The navmesh type name. Identifies different types of the navmeshes, used to sync navmesh properties with settings asset.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Color
member.summary: The navmesh type color (for debugging).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Rotation
member.summary: The navmesh rotation applied to navigation surface. Used during building to the rotate scene geometry and to revert back result during path finding queries. Can be used to generate navmesh on walls.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Agent
member.summary: The properties of the agent used to generate walkable navigation surface.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.DefaultQueryExtent
member.summary: The default extents for the nav queries that defines the search distance along each axis (x, y, z). Smaller values prevent queries from snapping to too far locations.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavAgentMask
member.summary: The navigation system agents selection mask (from navigation system settings). Uses 1 bit per agent type (up to 32 agents).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentMask.Mask
member.summary: The agents selection mask.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavMeshHit
member.summary: The result information for navigation mesh queries.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshHit.Position
member.summary: The hit point position.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshHit.Distance
member.summary: The distance to hit point (from the query origin).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshHit.Normal
member.summary: The hit point normal vector.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties
member.summary: The navigation area properties container for navmesh building and navigation runtime.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Name
member.summary: The area type name. Identifies different types of the areas.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Color
member.summary: The area type color (for debugging). Alpha channel is used to blend with navmesh color (alpha 0 to use navmesh color only).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Id
member.summary: The area id. It must be unique for the project. Valid range 0-63. Value 0 is reserved for Null areas (empty, non-navigable areas).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Cost
member.summary: The cost scale for the area traversal for agents. The higher the cost, the less likely agent wil choose the path that goes over it. For instance, areas that are harder to move like sand should have higher cost for proper path finding.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavLink
member.summary: The off-mesh link objects used to define a custom point-to-point edge within the navigation graph. An off-mesh connection is a user defined traversable connection made up to two vertices, at least one of which resides within a navigation mesh polygon allowing movement outside the navigation mesh.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.NavLink.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.Start
member.summary: The start location which transform is representing link start position. It is defined in local-space of the actor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.End
member.summary: The end location which transform is representing link end position. It is defined in local-space of the actor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.Radius
member.summary: The maximum radius of the agents that can go through the link.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.BiDirectional
member.summary: Flag used to define links that can be traversed in both directions. When set to false the link can only be traversed from start to end.

member.summary: Disconnects from the server.

Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType
member.summary: The low-level network channel type for message sending.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType.None
member.summary: Invalid channel type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType.Unreliable
member.summary: Unreliable channel type. Messages can be lost or arrive out-of-order.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType.UnreliableOrdered
member.summary: Unreliable-ordered channel type. Messages can be lost but always arrive in order.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType.Reliable
member.summary: Reliable channel type. Messages won't be lost but may arrive out-of-order.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType.ReliableOrdered
member.summary: Reliable-ordered channel type. Messages won't be lost and always arrive in order.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkDriverType
member.summary: Network driver implementations enum. [Deprecated in v1.3]

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkDriverType.Undefined
member.summary: Invalid network driver implementation.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkDriverType.ENet
member.summary: ENet library based network driver implementation.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig
member.summary: Low-level network configuration structure. Provides settings for the network driver and all internal components.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.NetworkDriverType
member.summary: The network driver that will be used to create the peer. To allow two peers to connect, they must use the same host. [Deprecated in v1.3]

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.NetworkDriver
member.summary: The network driver instance (implements INetworkDriver) that will be used to create and manage the peer, send and receive messages.
member.remarks: Object is managed by the created network peer (will be deleted on peer shutdown).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.ConnectionsLimit
member.summary: The upper limit on how many peers can join when we're listening.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.Address
member.summary: Address used to connect to or listen at.
member.remarks: Set it to "any" when you want to listen at all available addresses.
Only IPv4 is supported.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.Port
member.summary: The port to connect to or listen at.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.MessageSize
member.summary: The size of a message buffer in bytes. Should be lower than the MTU (maximal transmission unit) - typically 1500 bytes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.MessagePoolSize
member.summary: The amount of pooled messages that can be used at once (receiving and sending!).
member.remarks: Creating more messages than this limit will result in a crash! This should be tweaked manually to fit the needs (adjusting this value will increase/decrease memory usage)!

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType
member.summary: Network event type enum contains all possible events that can be returned by PopEvent function.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Undefined
member.summary: Invalid network event type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Connected
member.summary: Event "connected" - client connected to our server or we've connected to the server.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Disconnected
member.summary: Event "disconnected" - client disconnected from our server or we've been kicked from the server.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Timeout
member.summary: Event "disconnected" - client got a timeout from our server or we've list the connection to the server.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Message
member.summary: Event "message" - message received from some client or the server.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent.EventType
member.summary: The type of the received event.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent.Message
member.summary: The message when this event is an "message" event - not valid in any other cases. If this is an message-event, make sure to return the message using RecycleMessage function of the peer after processing it!

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent.Sender
member.summary: The connected of the client that has sent message, connected, disconnected or got a timeout.
member.remarks: Only valid when event has been received on server-peer.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer
member.summary: Low-level network peer class. Provides server-client communication functions, message processing and sending.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.Listen
member.summary: Starts listening for incoming connections. Once this is called, this peer becomes a server.
member.returns: True when succeeded.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.Connect
member.summary: Starts connection handshake with the end point specified in the structure. Once this is called, this peer becomes a client.
member.returns: True when succeeded.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the server.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the client!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.Disconnect(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConnection)
member.summary: Disconnects given connection from the server.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the server!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.PopEvent(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent@)
member.summary: Tries to pop an network event from the queue.
member.returns: True when succeeded and the event can be processed.
member.remarks: If this returns message event, make sure to recycle the message using function after processing it!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.CreateMessage
member.summary: Acquires new message from the pool. Cannot acquire more messages than the limit specified in the structure.
member.returns: The acquired message.
member.remarks: Make sure to recycle the message to this peer once it is no longer needed!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.RecycleMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage)
member.summary: Returns given message to the pool.
member.remarks: Make sure that this message belongs to the peer and has not been recycled already (debug build checks for this)!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.BeginSendMessage
member.summary: Acquires new message from the pool and setups it for sending.
member.returns: The acquired message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.AbortSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage)
member.summary: Aborts given message send. This effectively deinitializes the message and returns it to the pool.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.EndSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage)
member.summary: Sends given message over specified channel to the server.
member.param: The channel to send the message over.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the client!
Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.EndSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConnection)
member.summary: Sends given message over specified channel to the given client connection (target).
member.param: The channel to send the message over.
The client connection to send the message to.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the server!
Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.EndSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConnection[])
member.summary: Sends given message over specified channel to the given client connection (target).
member.param: The channel to send the message over.
The connections list to send the message to.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the server!
Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.CreatePeer(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig)
member.summary: Creates new peer using given configuration.
member.param: The configuration to create and setup new peer.
member.returns: The peer.
member.remarks: Peer should be destroyed using once it is no longer in use. Returns null if failed to create a peer (eg. config is invalid).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.ShutdownPeer(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer)
member.summary: Shutdowns and destroys given peer.

member.summary: Determines whether the particle effect should take into account the global game time scale for simulation updates.

member.summary: Determines whether the particle effect should loop when it finishes playing.

member.summary: The draw passes to use for rendering this object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsKinematic
member.summary: Enables kinematic mode for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
Kinematic rigidbodies are special dynamic actors that are not influenced by forces(such as gravity), and have no momentum. They are considered to have infinite mass and can push regular dynamic actors out of the way. Kinematics will not collide with static or other kinematic objects.
Kinematic rigidbodies are great for moving platforms or characters, where direct motion control is desired.
Kinematic rigidbodies are incompatible with CCD.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce linear movement.
member.remarks: Linear damping can be used to slow down an object. The higher the drag the more the object slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce angular movement.
member.remarks: Angular damping can be used to slow down the rotation of an object. The higher the drag the more the rotation slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableSimulation
member.summary: If true simulation and collisions detection will be enabled for the rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UseCCD
member.summary: If true Continuous Collision Detection (CCD) will be used for this component.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableGravity
member.summary: If object should have the force of gravity applied.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.StartAwake
member.summary: If object should start awake, or if it should initially be sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMassWhenScaleChanges
member.summary: If true, it will update mass when actor scale changes.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxAngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angular velocity that a simulated object can achieve.
member.remarks: The angular velocity of rigidbodies is clamped to MaxAngularVelocity to avoid numerical instability with fast rotating bodies. Because this may prevent intentional fast rotations on objects such as wheels, you can override this value per rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.OverrideMass
member.summary: Override the auto computed mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass value measured in kilograms (use override value only if OverrideMass is checked).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MassScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the per-instance scaling of the mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMassOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the user specified offset for the center of mass of this object, from the calculated location.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the object movement constraint flags that define degrees of freedom are allowed for the simulation of object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear velocity of the rigidbody.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular velocity of the rigidbody measured in radians per second.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current angular velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depenetration velocity when rigidbody moving out of penetrating state.
member.remarks: This value controls how much velocity the solver can introduce to correct for penetrations in contacts. Using this property can smooth objects moving out of colliding state and prevent unstable motion.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SleepThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass-normalized kinetic energy threshold below which an actor may go to sleep.
member.remarks: Actors whose kinetic energy divided by their mass is below this threshold will be candidates for sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMass
member.summary: Gets the center of the mass in the local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsSleeping
member.summary: Determines whether this rigidbody is sleeping.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Sleep
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to sleep (for at least one frame).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.WakeUp
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to wake up.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMass
member.summary: Updates the actor's mass (auto calculated mass from density and inertia tensor or overriden value).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the world space to the rigidbody at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce any torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddForceAtPosition(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the world space to the rigidbody at given position in the world space.
member.remarks:
Also applies appropriate amount of torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the world space.
The position of the force/impulse in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system) at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce any torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the world space to the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system).
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SetSolverIterationCounts(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the solver iteration counts for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
The solver iteration count determines how accurately joints and contacts are resolved. If you are having trouble with jointed bodies oscillating and behaving erratically, then setting a higher position iteration count may improve their stability.
If intersecting bodies are being depenetrated too violently, increase the number of velocity iterations. More velocity iterations will drive the relative exit velocity of the intersecting objects closer to the correct value given the restitution.
Default: 4 position iterations, 1 velocity iteration.
member.param: The minimum number of position iterations the solver should perform for this body.
The minimum number of velocity iterations the solver should perform for this body.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.ClosestPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Gets a point on one of the colliders attached to the attached that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.
member.param: The position to find the closest point to it.
The result point on the rigidbody shape that is closest to the specified location.

member.summary: Vehicle differential settings.

member.summary: Type of differential.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.FrontRearSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between front and rear (higher then 0.5 means more to front, smaller than 0.5 means more to rear). Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and Open4W.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.FrontLeftRightSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between front-left and front-right (higher then 0.5 means more to front-left, smaller than 0.5 means more to front-right). Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and Open4W and LimitedSlipFrontDrive.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.RearLeftRightSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between rear-left and rear-right (higher then 0.5 means more to rear-left, smaller than 0.5 means more to rear-right). Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and Open4W and LimitedSlipRearDrive.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.CentreBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of average front wheel rotation speed and rear wheel rotation speeds. The differential will divert more torque to the slower wheels when the bias is exceeded. Only applied to LimitedSlip4W.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.FrontBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of front-left and front-right wheel rotation speeds. The differential will divert more torque to the slower wheel when the bias is exceeded. Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and LimitedSlipFrontDrive.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.RearBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of rear-left and rear-right wheel rotation speeds. The differential will divert more torque to the slower wheel when the bias is exceeded. Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and LimitedSlipRearDrive.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings

member.summary: If enabled the vehicle gears will be changes automatically, otherwise it's fully manual.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings.SwitchTime
member.summary: Time it takes to switch gear. Specified in seconds (s).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings.ClutchStrength
member.summary: Strength of clutch. A stronger clutch more strongly couples the engine to the wheels, while a clutch of strength zero completely decouples the engine from the wheels. Stronger clutches more quickly bring the wheels and engine into equilibrium, while weaker clutches take longer, resulting in periods of clutch slip and delays in power transmission from the engine to the wheels. Specified in kilograms metres-squared per second (kg m^2 s^-1).

member.summary: Wheel placement type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.Mass
member.summary: Combined mass of the wheel and the tire in kg. Typically, a wheel has mass between 20Kg and 80Kg but can be lower and higher depending on the vehicle.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.Radius
member.summary: Distance in metres between the center of the wheel and the outside rim of the tire. It is important that the value of the radius closely matches the radius of the render mesh of the wheel. Any mismatch will result in the wheels either hovering above the ground or intersecting the ground.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.Width
member.summary: Full width of the wheel in metres. This parameter has no bearing on the handling but is a very useful parameter to have when trying to render debug data relating to the wheel/tire/suspension.

member.summary: Max steer angle that can be achieved by the wheel (in degrees).

member.summary: Damping rate applied to wheel. Specified in kilograms metres-squared per second (kg m^2 s^-1).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.MaxBrakeTorque
member.summary: Max brake torque that can be applied to wheel. Specified in kilograms metres-squared per second-squared (kg m^2 s^-2)

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.MaxHandBrakeTorque
member.summary: Max handbrake torque that can be applied to wheel. Specified in kilograms metres-squared per second-squared (kg m^2 s^-2)

member.summary: Gets or sets the non-walkable mode for the character controller.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.StepOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the step height. The character will step up a stair only if it is closer to the ground than the indicated value. This should not be greater than the Character Controllers height or it will generate an error.

member.summary: Gets or sets the character up vector.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.MinMoveDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum move distance of the character controller. The minimum traveled distance to consider. If traveled distance is smaller, the character doesn't move. This is used to stop the recursive motion algorithm when remaining distance to travel is small.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Velocity
member.summary: Gets the linear velocity of the Character Controller. This allows tracking how fast the character is actually moving, for instance when it is stuck at a wall this value will be the near zero vector.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.IsGrounded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this character was grounded during last move call grounded.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Flags
member.summary: Gets the current collision flags. Tells which parts of the character capsule collided with the environment during the last move call. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.SimpleMove(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character with the given speed. Gravity is automatically applied. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Move(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character using a 'collide-and-slide' algorithm. Attempts to move the controller by the given displacement vector, the motion will only be constrained by collisions. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move. This function does not apply any gravity.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.ContactOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact offset.
member.remarks: Colliders whose distance is less than the sum of their ContactOffset values will generate contacts. The contact offset must be positive. Contact offset allows the collision detection system to predictively enforce the contact constraint even when the objects are slightly separated.

The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets a point on the collider that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.

The result point on the collider that is closest to the specified location.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.ContainsPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Checks if a point is inside the collider.
member.param: The point to check if is contained by the collider shape (in world-space).
member.returns: True if collider shape contains a given point, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.ComputePenetration(FlaxEngine.Collider,FlaxEngine.Collider,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Computes minimum translational distance between two geometry objects. Translating the first collider by direction * distance will separate the colliders apart if the function returned true. Otherwise, direction and distance are not defined. The one of the colliders has to be BoxCollider, SphereCollider CapsuleCollider or a convex MeshCollider. The other one can be any type. If objects do not overlap, the function can not compute the distance and returns false.
member.param: The computed direction along which the translation required to separate the colliders apart is minimal. Valid only if function returns true.
The penetration distance along direction that is required to separate the colliders apart. Valid only if function returns true.
member.returns: True if the distance has successfully been computed, i.e. if objects do overlap, otherwise false.

member.summary: A storage data type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.ConvexMesh
member.summary: A convex polyhedron represented as a set of vertices and polygonal faces. The number of vertices and faces of a convex mesh is limited to 255.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.TriangleMesh
member.summary: A collision triangle mesh consists of a collection of vertices and the triangle indices.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags
member.summary: Set of flags used to generate model convex mesh. Allows to customize process.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Disables the convex mesh validation to speed-up hull creation. Creating a convex mesh with invalid input data without prior validation may result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UsePlaneShifting
member.summary:
Enables plane shifting vertex limit algorithm.
Plane shifting is an alternative algorithm for the case when the computed hull has more vertices than the specified vertex limit.
The default algorithm computes the full hull, and an OBB around the input vertices. This OBB is then sliced with the hull planes until the vertex limit is reached. The default algorithm requires the vertex limit to be set to at least 8, and typically produces results that are much better quality than are produced by plane shifting.
When plane shifting is enabled, the hull computation stops when vertex limit is reached.The hull planes are then shifted to contain all input vertices, and the new plane intersection points are then used to generate the final hull with the given vertex limit.Plane shifting may produce sharp edges to vertices very far away from the input cloud, and does not guarantee that all input vertices are inside the resulting hull. However, it can be used with a vertex limit as low as 4.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UseFastInteriaComputation
member.summary: Inertia tensor computation is faster using SIMD code, but the precision is lower, which may result in incorrect inertia for very thin hulls.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.ShiftVertices
member.summary: Convex hull input vertices are shifted to be around origin to provide better computation stability. It is recommended to provide input vertices around the origin, otherwise use this flag to improve numerical stability.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.SuppressFaceRemapTable
member.summary: If checked, the face remap table is not created. This saves a significant amount of memory, but disabled ability to remap the cooked collision geometry into original mesh using raycast hit info.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.FastCook
member.summary: The combination of flags that improve the collision data cooking performance at the cost of quality and features. Recommend for runtime dynamic or deformable objects that need quick collision updates.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType
member.summary: Type of drives that can be used for moving or rotating bodies attached to the joint.
member.remarks:
Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: force = spring * (target position - position) + damping * (targetVelocity - velocity)
Alternatively, the spring may be configured to generate a specified acceleration instead of a force.
A linear axis is affected by drive only if the corresponding drive flag is set.There are two possible models for angular drive : swing / twist, which may be used to drive one or more angular degrees of freedom, or slerp, which may only be used to drive all three angular degrees simultaneously.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.X
member.summary: Linear movement on the X axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Y
member.summary: Linear movement on the Y axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Z
member.summary: Linear movement on the Z axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Swing
member.summary: Rotation around the Y axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Twist
member.summary: Rotation around the Z axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Slerp
member.summary: Rotation using spherical linear interpolation. Uses the SLERP angular drive mode which performs rotation by interpolating the quaternion values directly over the shortest path (applies to all three axes, which they all must be unlocked).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.MAX
member.summary: The count of items in the D6JointDriveType enum.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive
member.summary: Specifies parameters for a drive that will attempt to move the joint bodies to the specified drive position and velocity.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Stiffness
member.summary: The spring strength. Force proportional to the position error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Damping
member.summary: Damping strength. Force proportional to the velocity error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.ForceLimit
member.summary: The maximum force the drive can apply.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Acceleration
member.summary: If true the drive will generate acceleration instead of forces. Acceleration drives are easier to tune as they account for the masses of the actors to which the joint is attached.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Default
member.summary: The default structure.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: if set to true the drive will generate acceleration instead of forces.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6Joint
member.summary: Physics joint that is the most customizable type of joint. This joint type can be used to create all other built-in joint types, and to design your own custom ones, but is less intuitive to use. Allows a specification of a linear constraint (for example for a slider), twist constraint (rotating around X) and swing constraint (rotating around Y and Z). It also allows you to constrain limits to only specific axes or completely lock specific axes.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.D6Joint.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Determines the linear limit used for constraining translation degrees of freedom.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.D6Joint.LimitTwist
member.summary: Determines the angular limit used for constraining the twist (rotation around X) degree of freedom.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.D6Joint.LimitSwing
member.summary: Determines the cone limit used for constraining the swing (rotation around Y and Z) degree of freedom.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Joint
member.summary: A base class for all Joint types. Joints constrain how two rigidbodies move relative to one another (for example a door hinge). One of the bodies in the joint must always be movable (non-kinematic and non-static).
member.remarks: Joint constraint is created between the parent physic actor (rigidbody, character controller, etc.) and the specified target actor.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Joint.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.Joint.JointBreak
member.summary: Occurs when a joint gets broken during simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.Target
member.summary: The target actor for the joint. It has to be IPhysicsActor type (eg. RigidBody or CharacterController).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.BreakForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the break force. Determines the maximum force the joint can apply before breaking. Broken joints no longer participate in physics simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.BreakTorque
member.summary: Gets or sets the break torque. Determines the maximum torque the joint can apply before breaking. Broken joints no longer participate in physics simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.EnableCollision
member.summary: Determines whether collision between the two bodies managed by the joint are enabled.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.EnableAutoAnchor
member.summary: Determines whether use automatic target anchor position and rotation based on the joint world-space frame (computed when creating joint).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.TargetAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the target anchor.
member.remarks: This is the relative pose which locates the joint frame relative to the target actor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.TargetAnchorRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the target anchor rotation.
member.remarks: This is the relative pose rotation which locates the joint frame relative to the target actor.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Joint.SetJointLocation(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the location of the joint by automatically computing local position and target anchor to place a joint at the given location (world-space).
member.remarks: Use this utility to automatically place joint at the given location after setting up joint parent and target.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Joint.SetJointOrientation(FlaxEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary: Sets the orientation of the joint by automatically computing local orientation and target anchor orientation to orient a joint at the given rotation (world-space).
member.remarks: Use this utility to automatically rotate joint at the given location after setting up joint parent and target.

member.summary: Gets the current force applied by the solver to maintain all constraints.

member.summary: Controls spring parameters for a physics joint limits. If a limit is soft (body bounces back due to restitution when the limit is reached) the spring will pull the body back towards the limit using the specified parameters.

member.summary: The spring strength. Force proportional to the position error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.SpringParameters.Damping
member.summary: Damping strength. Force proportional to the velocity error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.SpringParameters.Default
member.summary: The default structure.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.SpringParameters.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a spring.
member.param: Spring strength. Force proportional to the position error.
Damping strength. Force proportional to the velocity error.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange
member.summary: Represents a joint limit between two distance values. Lower value must be less than the upper value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.ContactDist
member.summary: Distance from the limit at which it becomes active. Allows the solver to activate earlier than the limit is reached to avoid breaking the limit.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Restitution
member.summary: Controls how do objects react when the limit is reached, values closer to zero specify non-elastic collision, while those closer to one specify more elastic (i.e bouncy) collision. Must be in [0, 1] range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Spring
member.summary: The spring that controls how are the bodies pulled back towards the limit when they breach it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Lower
member.summary: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Upper
member.summary: The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Default
member.summary: The default structure with empty limit.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a hard limit. Once the limit is reached the movement of the attached bodies will come to a stop.
member.param: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.
The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.
Distance from the limit at which it becomes active. Allows the solver to activate earlier than the limit is reached to avoid breaking the limit. Specify -1 for the default.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,FlaxEngine.SpringParameters,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a soft limit. Once the limit is reached the bodies will bounce back according to the restitution parameter and will be pulled back towards the limit by the provided spring.
member.param: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.
The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.
The spring that controls how are the bodies pulled back towards the limit when they breach it.

Controls how do objects react when the limit is reached, values closer to zero specify non-elastic collision, while those closer to one specify more elastic (i.e bouncy) collision. Must be in [0, 1] range.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint
member.summary: Physics joint that removes all translational degrees of freedom but allows all rotational degrees of freedom. Essentially this ensures that the anchor points of the two bodies are always coincident. Bodies are allowed to rotate around the anchor points, and their rotation can be limited by an elliptical cone.

member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.

member.returns: True if ray hits an matching object, otherwise false.

member.summary: Finds all colliders touching or inside of the given convex mesh.
member.param: Collision data of the convex mesh.
The scale of the convex mesh.
The result colliders that overlap with the given convex mesh. Valid only when method returns true.
The layer mask used to filter the results.
If set to true triggers will be hit, otherwise will skip them.
member.returns: True if convex mesh overlaps any matching object, otherwise false.

member.summary: Finds all colliders touching or inside of the given box.
member.param: The half size of the box in each direction.
The result colliders that overlap with the given box. Valid only when method returns true.
The layer mask used to filter the results.
If set to true triggers will be hit, otherwise will skip them.
member.returns: True if box overlaps any matching object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.PhysicsScene.OverlapSphere(FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single,FlaxEngine.PhysicsColliderActor[]@,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all colliders touching or inside of the given sphere.
member.param: The result colliders that overlap with the given sphere. Valid only when method returns true.
The layer mask used to filter the results.
If set to true triggers will be hit, otherwise will skip them.
member.returns: True if sphere overlaps any matching object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.PhysicsScene.OverlapCapsule(FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single,FlaxEngine.PhysicsColliderActor[]@,FlaxEngine.Quaternion,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all colliders touching or inside of the given capsule.
member.param: The height of the capsule, excluding the top and bottom spheres.
The result colliders that overlap with the given capsule. Valid only when method returns true.
The layer mask used to filter the results.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode
member.summary: Enumeration that determines the way in which two material properties will be combined to yield a friction or restitution coefficient for a collision.
member.remarks: Physics doesn't have any inherent combinations because the coefficients are determined empirically on a case by case basis. However, simulating this with a pairwise lookup table is often impractical. The effective combine mode for the pair is maximum(material0.combineMode, material1.combineMode).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Average
member.summary: Uses the average value of the touching materials: (a+b)/2.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Minimum
member.summary: Uses the smaller value of the touching materials: min(a,b)

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the values of the touching materials: a*b

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Maximum
member.summary: Uses the larger value of the touching materials: max(a, b)

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ForceMode
member.summary: Force mode type determines the exact operation that is carried out when applying the force on a rigidbody.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Force
member.summary: Add a continuous force to the rigidbody, using its mass. The parameter has unit of mass * distance / time^2, i.e. a force.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Impulse
member.summary: Add an instant force impulse to the rigidbody, using its mass. The parameter has unit of mass * distance / time.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.VelocityChange
member.summary: Add an instant velocity change to the rigidbody, ignoring its mass. The parameter has unit of distance / time, i.e. the effect is mass independent: a velocity change.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Acceleration
member.summary: Add a continuous acceleration to the rigidbody, ignoring its mass. The parameter has unit of distance / time^2, i.e. an acceleration. It gets treated just like a force except the mass is not divided out before integration.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints
member.summary: Dynamic rigidbodies movement and rotation locking flags. Provide a mechanism to lock motion along/around a specific axis or set of axes to constrain object motion.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.None
member.summary: No constraints.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionX
member.summary: Freeze motion along the X-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionY
member.summary: Freeze motion along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionZ
member.summary: Freeze motion along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationX
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the X-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationY
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationZ
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPosition
member.summary: Freeze motion along all axes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotation
member.summary: Freeze rotation along all axes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockAll
member.summary: Freeze rotation and motion along all axes.

member.summary: Requests the streaming update for all the loaded resources. Use it to refresh content streaming after changing configuration.

member.summary: Gets the texture sampler for a given texture group. Sampler objects is managed and cached by streaming service. Returned value is always valid (uses fallback object).
member.returns: The texture sampler (always valid).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup
member.summary: Settings container for a group of textures. Defines the data streaming options and resource quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.Name
member.summary: The name of the group.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.SamplerFilter
member.summary: The default filtering method for samplers using this texture group.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MaxAnisotropy
member.summary: The maximum number of samples that can be used to improve the quality of sample footprints that are anisotropic. Higher values improve texturing but reduce performance. Limited by GPU capabilities and used only if SamplerFilter is Anisotropic.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.Quality
member.summary: The quality scale factor applied to textures in this group. Can be used to increase or decrease textures resolution. In range 0-1 where 0 means lowest quality, 1 means full quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.QualityIfInvisible
member.summary: The quality scale factor applied when texture is invisible for some time (defined by TimeToInvisible). Used to decrease texture quality when it's not rendered.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.TimeToInvisible
member.summary: The time (in seconds) after which texture is considered to be invisible (if it's not rendered by a certain amount of time).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MipLevelsMin
member.summary: The minimum amount of loaded mip levels for textures in this group. Defines the amount of the mips that should be always loaded. Higher values decrease streaming usage and keep more mips loaded.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MipLevelsMax
member.summary: The maximum amount of loaded mip levels for textures in this group. Defines the maximum amount of the mips that can be loaded. Overriden per-platform. Lower values reduce textures quality and improve performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MipLevelsBias
member.summary: The loaded mip levels bias for textures in this group. Can be used to increase or decrease quality of the streaming for textures in this group (eg. bump up the quality during cinematic sequence).

member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain forced Level Of Detail index. Allows to bind the given chunks LOD to show. Value -1 disables this feature.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.LODDistribution
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain LODs distribution parameter. Adjusts terrain chunks transitions distances. Use lower value to increase terrain quality or higher value to increase performance. Default value is 0.75.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.ScaleInLightmap
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain scale in lightmap (applied to all the chunks). Use value higher than 1 to increase baked lighting resolution.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.BoundsExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain chunks bounds extent. Values used to expand terrain chunks bounding boxes. Use it when your terrain material is performing vertex offset operations on a GPU.

member.summary: Gets or sets the terrain geometry LOD index used for collision.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Terrain.LODCount

member.summary: Gets the chunk material that overrides the terrain default one.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetChunkOverrideMaterial(FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.MaterialBase)
member.summary: Sets the chunk material to override the terrain default one.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Single*,System.Byte*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The height map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The height map. Each array item contains a height value.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchSplatMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Color32*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch layer weights using the specified splatmaps data.
member.param: The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.
The splatmap map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.Setup(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Setups the terrain. Clears the existing data.
member.param: The LODs count. The actual amount of LODs may be lower due to provided chunk size (each LOD has 4 times less quads).
The size of the chunk (amount of quads per edge for the highest LOD). Must be power of two minus one (eg. 63 or 127).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.AddPatches(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Adds the patches to the terrain (clears existing ones).
member.param: The number of patches (x and z axis).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.AddPatch(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Adds the patch.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RemovePatch(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Removes the patch.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this terrain collision shape.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Ray,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this terrain collision shape. Returns the hit chunk.
member.param: The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit terrain patch coordinates (x and z). Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit terrain chunk coordinates (relative to the patch, x and z). Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.RayCastHit@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against terrain collision, returns results in a RayCastHit structure.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The result hit information. Valid only when method returns true.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.

The height map. Each array item contains a height value (2D inlined array). It should has size equal (chunkSize*4+1)^2.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.

The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.summary: Waits for all dispatched jobs until a given label to finish (i.e. waits for a Dispatch that returned that label).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftDistance(FlaxEngine.Vector3[])
member.summary: Get the distance which when added to camera position along the lookat direction will do the effect of zoom to extents (zoom to fit) operation, so all the passed points will fit in the current view. if the returned value is positive, the camera will move toward the lookat direction (ZoomIn). if the returned value is negative, the camera will move in the reverse direction of the lookat direction (ZoomOut).
member.returns: The zoom to fit distance

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftDistance(FlaxEngine.BoundingBox@)
member.summary: Get the distance which when added to camera position along the lookat direction will do the effect of zoom to extents (zoom to fit) operation, so all the passed points will fit in the current view. if the returned value is positive, the camera will move toward the lookat direction (ZoomIn). if the returned value is negative, the camera will move in the reverse direction of the lookat direction (ZoomOut).
member.returns: The zoom to fit distance

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftVector(FlaxEngine.Vector3[])
member.summary: Get the vector shift which when added to camera position will do the effect of zoom to extents (zoom to fit) operation, so all the passed points will fit in the current view.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CollisionsHelper.RayIntersectsPoint(FlaxEngine.Ray@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
